title: ICE register-attr-tool-import.rs with -Zsave-analysis

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-save-analysis
labels.description: Area: saving results of analyses such as inference and borrowck results to a file.

body:
### Code command: `RUST_BACKTRACE=1 ./build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage2/bin/rustc src/test/ui/attributes/register-attr-tool-import.rs -Zui-testing --emit metadata -Zsave-analysis -L src/test/ui/attributes/register-attr-tool-import/auxiliary -Lnative=build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/native/rust-test-helpers "-A" "unused" "--edition=2018"` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: rustc @ 3f9bddc7fea3ca1d49f39f22bb937a84ed32f84e ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'attempted .def_id() on invalid res: NonMacroAttr(Registered)', <::std::macros::panic macros>:5:6 ```
Backtrace

``` RUST_BACKTRACE=1 ./build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage2/bin/rustc src/test/ui/attributes/register-attr-tool-import.rs -Zui-testing --emit metadata -Zsave-analysis -L src/test/ui/attributes/register-attr-tool-import/auxiliary -Lnative=build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/native/rust-test-helpers "-A" "unused" "--edition=2018" error: cannot use an explicitly registered attribute through an import --> src/test/ui/attributes/register-attr-tool-import.rs:12:3 | LL | #[renamed_attr] //~ ERROR cannot use an explicitly registered attribute through an import | ^^^^^^^^^^^^ | note: the explicitly registered attribute imported here --> src/test/ui/attributes/register-attr-tool-import.rs:9:5 | LL | use attr as renamed_attr; // OK | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ error: cannot use a tool module through an import --> src/test/ui/attributes/register-attr-tool-import.rs:13:3 | LL | #[renamed_tool::attr] //~ ERROR cannot use a tool module through an import | ^^^^^^^^^^^^ | note: the tool module imported here --> src/test/ui/attributes/register-attr-tool-import.rs:10:5 | LL | use tool as renamed_tool; // OK | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ thread 'rustc' panicked at 'attempted .def_id() on invalid res: NonMacroAttr(Registered)', <::std::macros::panic macros>:5:6 stack backtrace: 0: ::fmt 1: core::fmt::write 2: std::io::Write::write_fmt 3: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}} 4: std::panicking::default_hook 5: rustc_driver::report_ice 6: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook 7: rust_begin_unwind 8: std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt 9: rustc_hir::def::Res::def_id::{{closure}} 10: rustc_save_analysis::dump_visitor::DumpVisitor::process_use_tree 11: ::visit_item 12: ::visit_mod 13: syntax::visit::walk_crate 14: rustc::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_ignore 15: rustc_session::utils::::time 16: rustc::ty::context::tls::enter_global 17: rustc_interface::interface::run_compiler_in_existing_thread_pool 18: syntax::attr::with_globals note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.43.0-dev running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -Z ui-testing -Z save-analysis query stack during panic: end of query stack error: aborting due to 2 previous errors ```
